style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />So Moses cried out to Yahweh, saying, \"God, I plead with you to heal her!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />But Yahweh replied, \"If her father had rebuked her for doing something wrong by spitting in her face, she would have been ashamed for seven days. She should be ashamed because of what she has done. So send her outside the camp for seven days. Then she will not have leprosy anymore, and she may return to the camp.\"\n\n  <verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />So they sent her outside the camp for seven days. The people did not move to another location until she returned.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "12-16", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />But after she returned, they left Hazeroth and moved north in the Paran Desert and set up their tents there.</para>\n"}], "number": "12", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "13-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />\"Send some men to Canaan to explore it. That is the land that I will give to you Israelites. Send men who are leaders in their tribes.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-03", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />So Moses did what Yahweh commanded him. He sent out twelve Israelite men who were all leaders of their tribes. He sent them from their camp at Paran in the desert.\n\n  <verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />These are the names of the men and the tribes they belonged to:</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">Shammua son of Zaccur, from the tribe of Reuben;</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\"></para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-05", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />Shaphat son of Hori, from the tribe of Simeon;\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />Caleb son of Jephunneh, from the tribe of Judah;</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />Igal son of Joseph, from the tribe of Issachar;</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />Hoshea the son of Nun, from the tribe of Ephraim;</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\"></para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-09", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />Palti son of Raphu, from the tribe of Benjamin;\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />Gaddiel son of Sodi, from the tribe of Zebulun;</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />Gaddi son of Susi, from the tribe of Manasseh;</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />Ammiel the son of Gemalli, from the tribe of Dan;</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\"></para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-13", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />Sethur son of Michael, from the tribe of Asher;\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />Nahbi son of Vophsi, from the tribe of Naphtali;</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />and Geuel son of Maki, from the tribe of Gad.\n\n<verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />Those are the names of the men whom Moses sent out to explore Canaan. Before they left, Moses gave Hoshea a new name, Joshua, which means 'Yahweh is the one who saves.'</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-17", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />Before Moses sent them to explore Canaan, he said to them, \"Go through the southern Judean wilderness, and then go north into the hill country.\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />See what the land is like. See if the people who live there are strong or weak. See if there are many people or only a few people.\n\n  <verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />Find out what kind of land they live in. Is it good or bad? Find out about the towns in which they live. Do they have walls around them or not?\n\n  <verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />Find out about the soil. Is it fertile or not? Find out if there are trees there. Try to bring back some of the fruit that grows in that land.\" He said that because it was the beginning of the time to harvest grapes.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-21", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />So those men went to Canaan. They went through the entire land, from the wilderness of Sin in the south all the way to the city of Rehob near Lebo Hamath in the north.\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />In the southern Judean wilderness, they went to Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, huge men descended from Anak, lived. Hebron was a city that was built seven years before the city of Zoan was built in Egypt.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-23", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />In one valley, they cut from a grapevine one cluster of grapes. Because it was very large, they needed two men to carry it on a pole. They also picked some pomegranates and some figs to carry back to their camp.\n\n<verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />They called that place Eshcol which means 'cluster' because they had cut that huge cluster of grapes there.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-25", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />After they explored the land for forty days, they returned to their camp.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />They came to Aaron and Moses and the rest of the Israelite people in the wilderness at Paran. They reported to everyone what they had seen. They also showed them the fruit that they had brought back.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-27", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />But this is what they reported to Moses: \"We arrived in the land that you sent us to explore. It is truly a beautiful land. It is a very fertile land. Here is some of the fruit.\n\n<verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />But the people who live there are very strong. Their cities are large and are surrounded by walls. We even saw some of the huge descendants of Anak there.\n\n<verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />The descendants of Amalek live in the southern part of the land, and the descendants of Heth, Jebus, and Amor live in the hill country to the north. The descendants of Canaan live along the coast of the Mediterranean Sea and along the Jordan River.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-30", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />When they said that, the people were afraid and started to cry out very loudly. But Caleb told the people who were standing near Moses to be quiet. Then he said, \"We should go there and take the land, because we are certainly able to conquer it!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"31\" style=\"v\" />But the men who had gone with him said, \"No, we cannot attack and defeat those people! They are much stronger than we are!\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "13-32", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"32\" style=\"v\" />So those men gave to the Israelite people a bad report about the land that they had explored. They said, \"The land that we explored is very large. We cannot conquer it. And all the people whom we saw are very tall.\n\n<verse number=\"33\" style=\"v\" />We even saw giants there. They are descendants of Anak. Their ancestors were giants. When we saw these people, we felt as small as grasshoppers, and they thought that we looked like grasshoppers too!\"\n"}], "number": "13", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "14-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />That night, all the Israelite people cried loudly.\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />The next day they all complained against Aaron and Moses. All the men said, \"We wish that we had died in Egypt, or in this wilderness!\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />Why is Yahweh bringing us to this land, where we men will be killed with swords? And they will take away our wives and children to be their slaves. Instead of going to Canaan, it would be better for us to return to Egypt!\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-04", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />Then some of them said to each other, \"We should choose a leader who will take us back to Egypt!\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />Then Aaron and Moses bowed down to pray in front of all the Israelite people who had gathered there.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-06", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />Joshua and Caleb, two of the men who had explored the land, tore their clothes because they were very dismayed.\n\n<verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />They said to the Israelite people, \"The land that we explored is very good.\n\n<verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />If Yahweh is pleased with us, he will lead us into that very fertile land, and he will give it to us.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-09", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />So do not rebel against Yahweh! And do not be afraid of the people in that land! We will gobble them up! They do not have anyone who will protect them, but Yahweh will be with us and help us. So do not be afraid of them!\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />Then all the Israelite people talked about killing Caleb and Joshua by throwing stones at them. But suddenly Yahweh's glory appeared to them at the sacred tent.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-11", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh said to Moses, \u201cHow long will these people reject me? I am tired of them not believing in what I can do, in spite of all the miracles I have performed among them.\n\n<verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />So I will send a plague among them and get rid of them. But I will cause your descendants to become a great nation. They will be a nation that is much greater and stronger than these people are.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-13", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />But Moses replied to Yahweh, \"Please do not do that, because the people of Egypt will hear about it! You brought these Israelite people from Egypt by your great power,\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />and the people of Egypt will tell that to the descendants of Canaan who live in this land. Yahweh, they have already heard about you. They know that you have been with these people and that they have seen you face to face. They have heard that your cloud is like a huge pillar that stays over them, and by that cloud you lead them during the day, and that the cloud becomes like a fire at night to give them light.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-15", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />If you kill these people all at one time, the people groups who have heard about your power will say,\n\n<verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />'Yahweh was not able to bring them into the land that he promised to give to them, so he killed them in the wilderness.'\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-17", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />So Yahweh, now show that you are very powerful. You said,\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />'I do not quickly become angry. Instead, I love people greatly, and I forgive people for having sinned and having disobeyed my laws. But I will always punish people who are guilty of doing what is wrong. When parents sin, I will punish them, but I will also punish their children and their grandchildren and their great-grandchildren and their great-great-grandchildren.'\n\n  <verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />So, because you love your people with a great covenant loyalty, forgive these people for the sins that they have committed, just like you have continued to forgive them ever since they left Egypt.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-20", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh replied, \"I have forgiven them, as you requested me to.\n\n  <verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />But, just as certainly as I live and that people all over the world can see my glory, I solemnly declare that\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />all these people saw my glory and all the miracles that I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness, but they disobeyed me, and many times they tested whether they could continue to do evil things without my punishing them.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-23", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />Because of that, not one of them will see the land that I promised their ancestors that I would give to them. No one who rejected me will see that land.\n\n<verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />But Caleb, who serves me well, is different from the others. He obeys me completely. So I will bring him into that land that he has already seen, and his descendants will inherit some of it.\n\n<verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />So, since the descendants of Amalek and Canaan who are living in the valleys in Canaan are very strong, when you leave here tomorrow, instead of traveling toward Canaan, go back along the road through the wilderness towards the Sea of Reeds.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-26", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh said to Aaron and Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />\"How long will the wicked people of this nation keep complaining about me? I have heard everything that they have grumbled against me.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-28", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />So now tell them this: 'Just as certainly as I, Yahweh, live, I will do exactly what you said would happen.\n\n<verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />I will cause all of you to die here in this wilderness! Because you grumbled against me, none of you who are more than twenty years old and who were counted when Moses counted everyone\n\n<verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />will enter the land that I solemnly promised to give to you. Only Caleb and Joshua will enter that land.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-31", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"31\" style=\"v\" />You said that your children would be taken from you to become slaves, but I will take them into the land, and they will enjoy living in the land that you rejected.\n\n<verse number=\"32\" style=\"v\" />But as for you adults, you will die here in this desert.\n\n<verse number=\"33\" style=\"v\" />And like shepherds wander around in the desert as they take care of their sheep, your children will wander around in this desert for forty years. Because you adults were not loyal to me, your children will suffer until you all die in the desert.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-34", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"34\" style=\"v\" />You will suffer for your sins for forty years. That will be one year for each of the forty days that the twelve men explored Canaan land. And I will be like an enemy to you.\n\n<verse number=\"35\" style=\"v\" />This will certainly happen because I, Yahweh, have said it! I will do these things to every one in this group that has plotted against me. They will all die right here in this wilderness!' \"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-36", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"36-37\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh attacked the ten men who had discouraged the people, so that they died. These were the men who had explored Canaan and then told the people that they would not be able to take over the land. It was because of the men that the people spoke against Moses.\n\n  <verse number=\"38\" style=\"v\" />Of the twelve men who had explored Canaan, only Joshua and Caleb remained alive.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-39", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"39\" style=\"v\" />When Moses reported to the Israelite people what Yahweh had said, many of them were very sad.\n\n  <verse number=\"40\" style=\"v\" />So the people got up early the next morning and started to go toward the hill country in Canaan. They said, \"We know that we have sinned, but now we are ready to enter the land that Yahweh promised to give to us.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-41", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"41\" style=\"v\" />But Moses said, \u201cYahweh commanded you to return to the desert, so why are you now disobeying him? It will not succeed.\n\n  <verse number=\"42\" style=\"v\" />Do not try to enter the land now! If you try, your enemies will defeat you, because Yahweh will not be with you.\n\n  <verse number=\"43\" style=\"v\" />When you begin to fight the descendants of Amalek and Canaan, they will slaughter you! Yahweh will abandon you, because you have abandoned him.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "14-44", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"44\" style=\"v\" />But even though Moses did not leave the camp, and the sacred chest that contained the Ten Commandments was not taken from the camp, the people began to go towards the hill country in Canaan.\n\n  <verse number=\"45\" style=\"v\" />Then the descendants of Amalek and Canaan who lived in those hills came down and attacked them; they chased them as far south as Hormah.</para>\n"}], "number": "14", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "15-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh told Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell this to the Israelite people, 'When you arrive in the land that I am giving to you,\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />you must offer to me special sacrifices which will be pleasing to me when the priest burns them on the altar. Some of them may be offerings that will be completely burned on the altar. Some of them may be to indicate that you have made a solemn promise to me. Some of them may be offerings that you yourselves have decided to make. Some of them may be offerings at one of the festivals that you celebrate each year. These offerings may be taken from your herds of cattle or from your flocks of sheep and goats.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-04", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />When you give these offerings, you must also bring to me a flour offering of about 2 liters of nice flour mixed with about a liter of olive oil.\n\n<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />When you offer a lamb to be a sacrifice to be completely burned, you must also pour on the altar about a liter of wine.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-06", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />When you offer a ram to be a sacrifice, you must also bring an offering of about 3.8 liters of finely ground flour mixed with about 1.25 liters of olive oil.\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />And also pour on the altar about 1.2 liters of wine. While they are being burned, the smell of it will be very pleasing to me.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-08", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />Sometimes you will offer a young bull to be completely burned on the altar. Sometimes you will offer a sacrifice to indicate that you have made a solemn promise to me. Sometimes you will offer a sacrifice to restore fellowship with me.\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />When you offer these sacrifices, you must also offer a flour offering of about 6.5 liters of finely ground flour mixed with about two liters of olive oil.\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />Also pour on the altar two quarts of wine to be an offering. While those special gifts are being burned, the smell from it will be very pleasing to me.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-11", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />Each time someone offers a bull or a ram or a male lamb or young goat to be a sacrifice, it must be done that way.\n\n<verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />You must obey these instructions for each animal that you bring to me for an offering.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />All of you people who have been Israelites all of your lives must obey these regulations when you offer sacrifices that will be pleasing to me when they are burned on the altar.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-14", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />If any foreigners visit you or live among you, if they also want to bring a sacrifice that will be pleasing to me when it is burned on the altar, they must obey these same instructions.\n\n<verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />I consider that those who have always been Israelites and those who are foreigners are equal, and so they must all obey the same instructions. All of your descendants must also continue to obey these instructions of mine.\n\n<verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />You Israelites and the foreigners who live among you must all obey the same instructions.' \"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-17", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh also said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell these instructions to the Israelite people, 'When you arrive in the land to which I am taking you,\n\n  <verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />and you eat the crops that are growing there, you must set some of them aside to be a sacred offering to me, and present them to me.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-20", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />Each year set aside some of the first grain that you gather after you have threshed it. Bake a loaf of bread from the first flour that you grind and present it before me as a sacred offering.\n\n<verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />Every year, you and your descendants must continue to make and present to me a loaf of bread baked with flour from the first part of the grain that you harvest.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-22", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />There may be times when you Israelites do not obey all these instructions that I have given to Moses to tell you, but not because you intended to disobey them.\n\n  <verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />There may be times when some of your descendants do not obey all these instructions that I have given to Moses to tell to you.\n\n  <verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />If you or they sin by forgetting to obey these instructions and none of the Israelite people realize that they were doing that, one young bull as an offering for all the people must be brought to the priest. That will be pleasing to me when it is burned on the altar. They must also bring to me a flour offering and an offering of wine, and a male goat, to be sacrificed to remove the guilt of their sin.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-25", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />By offering these sacrifices, the priest will make atonement for all of you Israelite people. Then, as a result of their bringing to me an offering to be burned on the altar, you will be forgiven, because you sinned without realizing that you were sinning.\n\n<verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />You Israelite people, and the foreigners who are living among you, will all be forgiven.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-27", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />If one person commits a sin without realizing that he was sinning, that person must bring to me a female goat to be an offering to take away that person's guilt for that sin.\n\n  <verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />The priest will offer it to be a sacrifice to remove the guilt of that person's sin, and that person will be forgiven.\n\n  <verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />You Israelites and all the foreigners who live among you must obey these same instructions.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-30", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />But those who disobey my commands deliberately, both Israelites and the foreigners who live among you, have sinned against me by doing that. So they must be expelled from your camp.\n\n  <verse number=\"31\" style=\"v\" />They have despised my commands and deliberately disobeyed them, so they must be punished for their sin by never being allowed to live among you again.' \"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-32", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"32\" style=\"v\" />One day, while the Israelites were in the wilderness, some of them saw a man who was gathering firewood on the Sabbath day.\n\n  <verse number=\"33\" style=\"v\" />Those who saw him doing that brought him to Aaron and Moses and the rest of the Israelite people.\n\n  <verse number=\"34\" style=\"v\" />They guarded him carefully, because they did not know what to do to punish him.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-35", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"35\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh said to Moses, \"The man must be executed. All of you must kill him by throwing stones at him outside the camp.\"\n\n<verse number=\"36\" style=\"v\" />So they all took the man outside the camp and killed him by throwing stones at him, as Yahweh had commanded Moses that they should do.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-37", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"37\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh also said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"38\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell this to the Israelite people: 'You and all your descendants must twist threads together to make tassels, and then attach them with blue cords to the bottom edges of your clothes.\n\n  <verse number=\"39\" style=\"v\" />When you look at the tassels, you will remember all the instructions that I gave to you, and you will obey them, instead of doing what you desire and as a result causing yourselves to become unacceptable to me.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "15-40", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"40\" style=\"v\" />Seeing those tassels will help you to remember that you must obey all my commands and that you must be my holy people.\n\n<verse number=\"41\" style=\"v\" />Do not forget that I am Yahweh, your God. I am the one who brought you out of Egypt in order that you might belong to me. I am Yahweh, your God.'\"\n"}], "number": "15", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "16-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />One day Korah son of Izhar and a descendant of Levi's son Kohath, conspired with Dathan and Abiram, who were the sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth. They were all from the tribe of Reuben.\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />Those four men incited 250 other people who were leaders among the Israelite people to join them in rebelling against Moses.\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />They came together to criticize Aaron and Moses. They said to them, \u201cYou two are using more authority than you should! Yahweh has set apart all of us Israelite people, and he is with all of us. So why do you act as though you were more important than the rest of us people who belong to Yahweh?\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-04", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />When Moses heard what they were saying, he prostrated himself on the ground.\n\n  <verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />Then he said to Korah and those who were with Korah, \"Tomorrow morning Yahweh will show to us whom he has chosen to be his priest, and who is holy and allowed to come near to him. Yahweh will permit only those whom he chooses to come into his presence.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-06", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />So Korah, tomorrow you and those who are with you must prepare your pans to burn incense.\n\n<verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />Then you must light a fire in them and burn the incense in the presence of Yahweh. Then we will see which one of us Yahweh has chosen to be his holy servant. It is you men who are descendants of Levi who are trying to use more authority than you should!\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-08", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />Then Moses spoke again to Korah. He said, \"You men who are descendants of Levi, listen to me!\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />The God of us Israelis has chosen all of you to be close to him in order that you can work for him at his sacred tent and serve the people. Does that seem to be unimportant?\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh has brought you, Korah, and your fellow descendants of Levi, near to himself. Now are you demanding to become priests also?\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />It is really Yahweh against whom you and your fellow descendants of Levi are rebelling. Aaron is not the one about whom you are really complaining.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-12", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />Then Moses summoned Dathan and Abiram, but they refused to come. They sent a message saying, \"We will not come to you!\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />You brought us out of Egypt, which was a very fertile land, in order to cause us to die here in this desert. That was bad. But now you are also trying to boss us, and that is worse.\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />You have not given us a new land to live in, a land that has good fields and vineyards. You are only trying to blind these people. So we will not come to you.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-15", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />Then Moses became very angry. He said to Yahweh, \"Do not accept the grain offerings that they have brought. I have not taken anything from them, not even one donkey, and I have never done anything wrong to them, so they have no reason to complain against me.\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />Then Moses said to Korah, \"You and all those who are with you must come here tomorrow and stand in front of Yahweh. Aaron will also be here.\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />You and all the 250 men who are with you must each take a pan in which to burn incense, and put incense in it, to burn it to be an offering to Yahweh. Aaron will do the same thing.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-18", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />So each of those men got a pan to burn incense. They put in it incense and hot coals to light it, and then they all stood at the entrance of the sacred tent with Aaron and Moses.\n\n  <verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />Then Korah summoned all the people who supported him and who were against Moses, and they also gathered at the entrance of the tent. Then the glory of Yahweh appeared to all of them</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-20", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />and Yahweh said to Aaron and Moses,\n\n<verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />\"Get away from all these people, in order that I can get rid of them immediately!\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />But Aaron and Moses prostrated themselves on the ground. They pleaded with Yahweh, saying, \u201cGod, you are the one who caused all these people to live. Only one of these men has sinned. So, is it right for you to be angry with all the people?\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-23", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />\"Okay, but tell all the people to get away from the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-25", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />So Moses stood up and went to the tents of Dathan and Abiram. The Israelite leaders followed him.\n\n  <verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />He told the people, \"Get away from the tents of these wicked men, and do not touch anything that belongs to them! If you touch anything, you will die because of their sins!\"\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />So all the people moved away from the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram. Dathan and Abiram came out of their tents with their wives and children and babies, and stood at the entrance of their tents.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-28", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />Then Moses said, \"I was not the one who decided to do all these things that I have done. It was Yahweh who chose me and sent me to do them. And now he will prove that to you.\n\n  <verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />If these men die in a normal way, then it will be clear that Yahweh did not choose me.\n\n  <verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />But if Yahweh does something that has never happened before, if he causes the ground that is under their feet to open up and swallow these men and their families and all their possessions, and they fall into the opening and are buried while they are still alive, then you will know that these men have insulted Yahweh.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-31", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"31\" style=\"v\" />As soon as Moses said this, the ground split open beneath those men.\n\n  <verse number=\"32\" style=\"v\" />It swallowed those men and their families and all those who were standing there with Korah and all of their possessions.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-33", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"33\" style=\"v\" />They fell into the opening in the ground while they were still alive, and all their possessions fell into the opening also. They disappeared, and the ground closed back up again.\n\n<verse number=\"34\" style=\"v\" />They screamed as they fell, and all the people who were standing nearby heard them scream. The people were terrified and cried out as they ran away, saying, \"We do not want the ground to swallow us, also!\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"35\" style=\"v\" />And then a fire from Yahweh came down from the sky and burned up the 250 men who were burning the incense!</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-36", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"36\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"37\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell Aaron's son Eleazar to take the pans that had incense in them away from the fire and to scatter the burning coals. The pans that those men were carrying are holy because they burned incense to me in them.\n\n  <verse number=\"38\" style=\"v\" />Those men have now died because of their sin. So Eleazar must take their pans and hammer the metal to make it become very thin. He must make a covering for the altar with that metal. Those pans were used to offer incense to me, so they are holy. What happened to those pans will now warn the Israelite people.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-39", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"39-40\" style=\"v\" />So Eleazar the priest collected the 250 pans for burning incense that had been used by the men who died in the fire. He hammered the pans very thin to make a covering for the altar, as Yahweh told Moses should be done. That warned the Israelites that only those who were descendants of Aaron were permitted to burn incense as an offering to Yahweh. If anyone else did that, the same thing would happen to him as happened to Korah and those with him.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-41", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"41\" style=\"v\" />But the following morning, all the Israelite people started to complain against Aaron and Moses saying \"You have killed many people who belonged to Yahweh!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"42\" style=\"v\" />When all the people gathered together to protest about what Aaron and Moses had done, they looked at the sacred tent and saw that the sacred cloud had covered it, and the glory of Yahweh had appeared.\n\n  <verse number=\"43\" style=\"v\" />Aaron and Moses went and stood in front of the sacred tent.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-44", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"44\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh said to Moses,\n\n<verse number=\"45\" style=\"v\" />\"Get away from these people, in order that I can get rid of them immediately without injuring you two!\" But Aaron and Moses prostrated themselves on the ground and prayed.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"46\" style=\"v\" />Moses said to Aaron, \u201cQuickly take another pan and put in it some burning coals from the altar. Put incense in the pan, and carry it out among the people to atone for the sins of the people. Yahweh is very angry with them, and I know that a severe plague has already started among them.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-47", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"47\" style=\"v\" />So Aaron did what Moses told him. He took the burning incense out among the people. The plague had already started to strike the people, but Aaron continued to burn the incense to make atonement for the sins of the people.\n\n<verse number=\"48\" style=\"v\" />He stood between the people who had already died and those who were still alive, and then the plague stopped.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "16-49", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"49\" style=\"v\" />But 14,700 people had already died from that plague, in addition to the people who died with Korah.\n\n<verse number=\"50\" style=\"v\" />Then after the plague had ended, Aaron and Moses returned to the entrance of the sacred tent.\n"}], "number": "16", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "17-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell the Israelite people to bring to you twelve walking sticks. They should bring one from each of the leaders of the twelve tribes. You should carve each leader's name on his stick.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "17-03", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />There must be one stick for the leader of each tribe, so you must carve Aaron's name on the stick for the tribe of Levi.\n\n<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />Put those sticks inside the sacred tent, in front of the sacred chest that has in it the tablets on which the Ten Commandments are written. That is the place where I always talk with you.\n\n<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />Buds will sprout on the stick of the man whom I have chosen to be the priest. When the people see that, they will stop their constantly complaining about you because they will realize that he is the one whom I have chosen.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "17-06", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />So Moses told the people what Yahweh had said. Then each of the twelve Israelite leaders, including Aaron, brought his walking stick to Moses.\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />Moses placed the sticks inside the sacred tent in front of the sacred chest.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "17-08", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />The following morning, when he went into the tent, he saw that Aaron's stick, which represented the tribe of Levi, had sprouted. It had produced leaves and blossoms, and it had also produced almonds that were ripe!\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />Moses brought all the sticks out of the sacred tent and showed them to the people. Each of the twelve leaders took back his own stick.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "17-10", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh said to Moses, \"Put Aaron's stick in front of the sacred chest, and let it stay there permanently. That will be a warning to people who want to rebel against me. Then no more people will die because of complaining against me.\"\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />So Moses did what Yahweh had commanded.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "17-12", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />Then the Israelite people said to Moses, \"We are going to die! All of us are surely going to die!\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />Everyone who comes close to Yahweh's sacred tent dies. Are the rest of us going to die, also?\" </para>\n"}], "number": "17", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "18-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh said to Aaron, \"You and your sons and the other members of your father's family are the ones who will be punished if anything bad happens to the things inside the sacred tent. And you and your sons will be punished if any priest does something bad.\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />Require that those who belong to your tribe, the tribe of Levi, must assist you and your sons while you perform your work at the sacred tent.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-03", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />But while they do that work, they must not go near the sacred items inside the tent or near the altar. If they do that, they will die, and you will die, too!\n\n<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />They may assist you in doing all the work to take care of the sacred tent, but no one else is permitted to come near the place where you are working.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />You are the ones who will do the sacred work inside the sacred tent and at the altar. If you obey these instructions, I will not become very angry with the Israelite people again.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-06", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />I myself have chosen the descendants of Levi from the other Israelites  in order that they may be your special helpers. They are like a gift that I have given you to work at the sacred tent.\n\n<verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />But it is you and your sons, who are the priests, who must perform all the details I have commanded concerning the altar and with what happens inside the Very Holy Place. I am giving to you this work of serving as priests. So anyone else who tries to do that work must be executed.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-08", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh also said to Aaron, \"I myself have appointed you to take care of all the sacred offerings that the Israelite people bring to me. I have given all these sacred offerings to you and to your sons. You and your descendants will get a share of these offerings permanently.\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />The parts of the offerings that are not completely burned on the altar belong to you. Those parts of the sacred offerings, including the flour offerings, the offerings to make atonement for sins and to remove the guilt of sins, are set apart, and are to be given to you and your sons.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-10", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />You must eat those offerings in a sacred place, near the sacred tent. You and all of the other males in your clan may eat it, but you must consider those offerings to be holy to me.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />The priests lift up high the sacred offerings while they are standing in front of the altar. All of those offerings that the Israelites present to me belong to you and your sons and daughters. They will always be your share. All the members of your family who have performed the rituals to cause them to be acceptable to me are permitted to eat from these offerings.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-12", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />I am also giving to you the first food that people harvest each year and bring to me\u2014the best olive oil and new wine and grain.\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />All of the first crops that people harvest and bring to me belong to you. Anyone in your family who has performed the ritual to become acceptable to me is permitted to eat that food.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-14", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />Everything in Israel that is devoted to me, will be yours.\n\n  <verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />The firstborn males, both humans and domestic animals, that are offered to me, will be yours. But people must buy back their firstborn sons and the firstborn animals that may not be used for sacrifices.\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />They must buy them back when they are one month old. The price that they must pay for each one is five pieces of silver. They must weigh the silver on the scales that are in the sacred tent.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-17", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />But they are not permitted to buy back the firstborn cattle or sheep or goats. They are holy and have been set apart for me. Slaughter them and sprinkle their blood on the altar. Then completely burn the fat of those animals on the altar to be an offering to me. The smell as they burn will be very pleasing to me.\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />The meat from those offerings will be yours, just like the breast and right thigh of animals that are presented to me to restore fellowship with me, as the priest lifts them up high in front of the altar, are yours.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-19", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />Anything that the Israelite people present to me as holy gifts, I am giving to you. They are for you and your sons and daughters to eat. They will always be your share. This is an agreement that I am making with you, an agreement that will last forever. I am also making this agreement with your descendants.\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh also said to Aaron, \"You priests will not receive any of the land or the property like the other Israelite people will receive. I am what you will receive.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-21", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />When the Israelite people bring to me a tenth of all the crops and of their newborn animals, I will give that to you descendants of Levi. That will be your payment for the work you do at the sacred tent.\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />The other Israelites must not go near that tent. If they go near it, I will consider that their doing that is a sin, and they will die for committing that sin.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-23", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />Only the descendants of Levi are permitted to work at the sacred tent, and they will be punished if anything bad happens to it. That is a law that will never be changed. You descendants of Levi will not receive any land among the other Israelite people,\n\n<verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />because I will give you one tenth of all the crops and animals that the Israelites present as offerings to me. That is why I said that you will not receive any land like the other Israelites will receive.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-25", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell this to the descendants of Levi, 'When you receive one tenth of all the crops and animals from the Israelite people, you must present one tenth of all that to me to be a sacred offering.\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />Just like the other Israelites present one tenth of the grain and wine that they produce,</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-28", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />you must present to me one tenth of all that you receive from them. That will be your sacred offering to me. You must present it to Aaron.\n\n<verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />Select the best parts of the things that are given to you to present them to me.'\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "18-30", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />Also, tell this to the descendants of Levi, 'When you present those best portions of grain and wine as your offering to me, I will consider that those gifts are as though they came from your own grain and wine.\n\n  <verse number=\"31\" style=\"v\" />You descendants of Levi and your families are permitted to eat the rest of that food, and you may eat it wherever you want to, because it is your payment for the work that you do at the sacred tent.\n\n  <verse number=\"32\" style=\"v\" />If you give to the priests the best portions of what you receive, you will not be punished by me for accepting one tenth of the gifts that the people bring to me. But you must consider those gifts to be sacred. If you sin by eating those things in ways that are contrary to these regulations that I have given to you, you will be executed.' \"</para>\n"}], "number": "18", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "19-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh said to Aaron and Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />\"I am now giving to you another regulation. Tell the Israelite people to bring to you one reddish brown cow that has no defects. It must be an animal that has never been used for plowing ground.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "19-03", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />Give it to Eleazar, the priest. He must take it outside the camp and slaughter it and catch the blood in a basin.\n\n<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />He must dip one of his fingers in the blood and sprinkle some of it seven times on the ground near the sacred tent.\n\n<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />Then, while Eleazar watches, the cow must be burned completely\u2014its hide, its meat, the rest of its blood, and even its dung.\n\n<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />Eliezer then must take a stick of cedar wood, a stalk of a plant named hyssop, and some scarlet yarn, and throw them into the fire where the cow is burning.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "19-07", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />Then the priest must wash his clothes and bathe. After doing that, he may return to the camp. But he will be unfit for doing any sacred work until that evening.\n\n  <verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />The man who burns the cow must also wash his clothes and bathe, and he will also be unacceptable to me until that evening.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "19-09", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />Then someone who has not become unacceptable to me must gather up the ashes of the cow and put them in a sacred place outside the camp. The ashes must be kept there for the people of Israel to use when they mix it with water for the ritual to remove the guilt of sin.\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />The man who gathers up the ashes of the cow must also wash his clothes, and he also will be unfit to do anymore sacred work until that evening. That is a regulation that will never be changed. It must be obeyed by you Israelite people and by any foreigners who live among you.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "19-11", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />All those who touch a corpse will be unacceptable to me for seven days.\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />On the third day and on the seventh day after touching a corpse, in order to become acceptable to me again, they must sprinkle on themselves some of that water for removing the guilt of their sin. If they do not do that on both of those days, they will continue to be unacceptable to me.\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />All those who touch a corpse, and do not perform in the correct way the ritual to become acceptable to me again, defile Yahweh's sacred tent. They will no longer be permitted to live among the Israelite people. The water to remove the guilt of sin was not sprinkled on them, so they continue to be unacceptable to me.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "19-14", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />There is another practice that must be performed when someone dies inside a tent. All those who were inside that tent when that person died or who enter that tent will be unacceptable to me for seven days.\n\n  <verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />Any jars that are inside that tent that are not covered are not permitted to be used.\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />If someone who is out in a field touches the corpse of someone who was murdered, or who died from natural causes, or if someone touches a bone from some human or touches a grave, that person will be unacceptable to me for seven days.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "19-17", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />For someone like that to become acceptable to me again, some of the ashes from the cow that was burned must be taken and put in a jar. Then some fresh water must be poured over the ashes.\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />Then someone who has not become unacceptable to me must take a stalk of a plant named hyssop and dip it into the water. Then that person must sprinkle some of the water on the tent where that person died, on the things that are in the tent, and on the people who were in the tent. He must also sprinkle some of that water on any person who touched a human bone or who touched a person who died, or who touched a grave.\n\n  <verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />On the third day and on the seventh day after that, the person who is acceptable to me must sprinkle some of that water on those who have become unacceptable to me. On the seventh day, the people who are performing that ritual to become acceptable to me again must wash their clothes and bathe. If they do that, on that evening they will become acceptable to me again.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "19-20", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />If those who have become unacceptable to me do not become acceptable to me again by doing this, they will no longer be permitted to live among to the Israelite people, because they have defiled my sacred tent. They did not sprinkle on themselves the water that removes the guilt of their sins, so they remain unacceptable to me.\n\n  <verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />That is a law for the Israelite people that will never be changed. Those who sprinkle that water on themselves must then wash their clothes. And anyone who touches that water which removes guilt for sins will remain unacceptable to God until that evening.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />Anything and any person that someone who has become unacceptable to me has touched will remain unacceptable to me until that evening.\"</para>\n"}], "number": "19", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "20-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />In March of the next year, the Israelite people traveled to the Wilderness of Sin and camped near Kadesh. While they were there, Moses' sister Miriam died and was buried there.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-02", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />There was no water for the people to drink there, so they came to Aaron and Moses.\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />They complained and said, \"We wish that we had died in front of Yahweh's sacred tent when our fellow Israelites died!</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-04", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />Did you bring us, who are Yahweh's people, into this desert to die along with our livestock?\n\n<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />Why did you bring us from Egypt to this miserable place? There is no grain, there are no figs, no grapes, and no pomegranates here. And there is no water for us to drink!\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-06", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />Moses and Aaron turned away from the people and went to the entrance of the sacred tent and prostrated themselves on the ground. Then Yahweh appeared to them with his bright glory,</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-07", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />and he said to Moses,\n\n<verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />\"You and Aaron must take Aaron's walking stick with you and gather all the people together. While the people are watching, command that large rock over there to pour out water. Water for the people will flow from it. All they and all their livestock will have enough water to drink.\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />So Moses did what Yahweh told him to do. He took Aaron's walking stick from the place in the sacred tent where it was kept.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-10", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />Then Moses and Aaron summoned all the people to gather at the rock. Then Moses shouted to them, \"All you rebellious people, listen! Is it necessary for us to bring to you water from this rock?\"\n\n<verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />Then Moses raised his hand and instead of speaking to the rock, he struck the rock two times with the walking stick. And water gushed out. So all the people and their livestock drank all the water that they wanted.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-12", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />But Yahweh said to Aaron and Moses, \"You did not trust me or honor me before the people of Israel, and so you will not lead them into the land I have given to them!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />Later this place was called the Meribah, which means 'arguing', because there the Israelite people argued against Yahweh, and there he showed his honor and holiness to them by giving them water.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-14", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />While the people were at Kadesh, Moses sent messengers to the king of Edom to tell him this,\"Your relatives, the Israelite people, are sending you this message. You know the many troubles that have happened to us.\n\n  <verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />You know that our ancestors went down to Egypt. You know that they stayed there for many years. They suffered because the rulers of Egypt caused them to become their slaves and to work very hard.\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />But when they called out to Yahweh, he heard them and sent an angel who brought them out of Egypt. Now we have set up our tents here at Kadesh, a town on the border of your land.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-17", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />Please allow us to travel through your country. We will be careful to not walk through your fields and your vineyards. We will not even drink water from your wells. As we travel, we will stay on the king's highway, the main road that goes from the south to the north, and we will not leave that road until we have crossed the border of your country in the north.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-18", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />But the king of Edom refused. He replied, \"Stay out of my country! If you try to enter it, I will send my army to attack you!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />The Israelite messengers replied, \"If we travel through your country, we will stay on the main road. If we and any of our livestock drink any of your water, we will pay for it. We want only to travel through your country. We do not want anything else.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-20", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />But the king replied, \"No! Stay out of our country! We will not allow you to travel through our land!\" Then he sent the strongest soldiers in his army to prevent the Israelites from entering his country.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />So, because the king of Edom refused to allow the Israelites to travel through his country, the Israelites turned and traveled a different way.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-22", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />The Israelite people left Kadesh. They went to Mount Hor,\n\n  <verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />which is at the border of Edom. While they were there, Yahweh said to Aaron and Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />\"It is time for Aaron to die. He will not enter the land that I am giving to you Israelites, because the two of you disobeyed me when I told you to speak to the rock to cause the water to flow at Meribah.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-25", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />Now you, Moses, take Aaron and his son Eleazar up on Mount Hor.\n\n<verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />There you must remove Aaron's clothes that he wears when he does the works of a priest, and put them on his son, Eleazar. Aaron will die up there.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "20-27", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />So Moses did what Yahweh commanded. The three of them climbed up Mount Hor, while all the Israelite people watched.\n\n  <verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />At the top of the mountain, Moses took off the clothes that Aaron wore while he did the work of a priest and put them on Eleazar. Then Aaron died there on the top of the mountain, and Eleazar and Moses went back down.\n\n  <verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />When the Israelite people realized that Aaron had died, they all mourned for him for thirty days.</para>\n"}], "number": "20", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "21-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />The king of the city of Arad lived in the area where the Canaanites lived, in the southern Judean wilderness. He heard a report that the Israelites were approaching on the road to Atharim village. So his army attacked the Israelites and captured some of them.\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />Then the Israelites declared this solemnly, \"Yahweh, if you will help us to defeat these people, we will completely destroy all their towns.\"\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh heard what they requested, and he enabled them to defeat the army of this Canaan people group. The Israelite soldiers killed all the people and destroyed their towns. Ever since that time, that place has been called Hormah which means \"destruction.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "21-04", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />Then the Israelites left Mount Hor and traveled on the road towards the Sea of Reeds, in order to go around the land of Edom. But the people became impatient along the way,\n\n  <verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />and they began to grumble against God and against Moses. They said, \u201cWhy have you brought us out of Egypt to die here in this desert? There is nothing to eat here, and nothing to drink. And we detest this lousy manna food!\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "21-06", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />So Yahweh sent poisonous snakes among them. Many of the people were bitten by the snakes and died.\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />Then the people came to Moses and cried out, saying, \u201cWe now know that we have sinned against Yahweh and against you. Pray to Yahweh, asking that he will take away the snakes!\u201d So Moses prayed for the people.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "21-08", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh told him, \u201cMake a model of a poisonous snake, and attach it to the top of a pole. If those who are bitten by the snakes look at that model, they will recover.\"\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />So Moses made a snake from bronze and attached it to the top of a pole. Then, when those who had been bitten by a snake looked at the bronze snake, they recovered!</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "21-10", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />Then the Israelites traveled to Oboth and camped there.\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />Then they left there, and went to Iye Abarim, in the desert wilderness on the eastern border of Moab.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "21-12", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />From there they traveled to the valley where the Zered riverbed is, and camped there.\n\n<verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />Then they traveled to the north side of the Arnon River. That area is in the desert wilderness next to the land where the Amorites live. The Arnon River is the boundary between Moab and where the Amorites live.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "21-14", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />That is why in the book called \"The Book of the Wars of Yahweh\" it tells about,\n\n<para style=\"q1\">\"Waheb in Suphah, and the ravines there,</para>\n\n<para style=\"q2\">and the Arnon River</para>\n\n<para style=\"q1\">\n\n<verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />and the ravines there,</para>\n\n<para style=\"q2\">which extend as far as Ar village on the border of Moab.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "21-16", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />From there the Israelites traveled to Beer. This was the message that they gave him,\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />\"Allow us to travel through your country. We will stay on the king's highway, the main road that goes from the south to the north, until we have finished traveling through your land. We will not walk through any field or vineyard, or drink water from your wells.\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />But King Sihon refused. He would not allow them to walk through his land. Instead, he sent his whole army to attack the Israelites in the desert. They attacked the Israelites at Jahaz village.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "21-24", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />But the Israelites completely defeated them and occupied their land, from the Arnon River in the south to the Jabbok River in the north. They stopped at the border of the land where the Ammon people group lived, because the Ammon army was defending the border strongly.\n\n<verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />So the Israelites occupied all the cities and towns where the Amorites lived, and some of the Israelites began to live in them. They occupied the city of Heshbon and the nearby villages.\n\n<verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />Heshbon was the capital of the country. It was the city where King Sihon ruled. His army had previously defeated the army of the king of Moab, and then his people had begun to live in all of the land of Moab as far as the Arnon River in the south.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "21-27", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />For that reason, one of the poets wrote long ago,</para>\n\n<para style=\"q1\">\"Come to Heshbon, the city where The Israelites defeated Og's army, and killed King Og and his sons and all his people. Not a person survived! And then the Israelites began to live in their land.</para>\n"}], "number": "21", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "22-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Then the Israelites traveled west to the plain of Moab that was in the valley of the Jordan River, across the river from Jericho.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-02", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />But King Balak son of Zippor, who ruled Moab, found out what the Israelites had done to the Amor people group.\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />When he saw that the Israelites were very numerous, he and his people became terrified.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />So the king of Moab went to the leaders of the Midian people group and said to them, \"This huge group of Israelites will wipe out everything around them, like an ox devours grass!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">Balak was the king of Moab.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-05", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />He sent messengers to a prophet named Balaam, who was living in his own area, in Pethor, near the Euphrates River. He sent this message to request that Balaam would come to help him,\"A huge group of people has arrived here from Egypt. It looks like they are covering the entire land! And they have begun to live close to us.\n\n<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />Because they are very powerful, we are afraid of them. So please come and curse them for me. Then my army may be able to defeat them and expel them from the land where they are now living. I know that good things will happen to the people whom you bless, and disasters will happen to the people whom you curse.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-07", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />Balak's messengers, who were leaders of both the Moab and Midian people groups, took money with them to pay Balaam in order that he would come and curse the Israelites. Please come immediately to curse them. Then I may be able to defeat them and expel them from this area.' \"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-12", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />God replied to Balaam, \"Do not go with them! I have blessed those people, so you must not curse them!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />The next morning, Balaam got up and told Balak's men, \"Go back home. But go by yourselves, because Yahweh is not allowing me to go with you.\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />So the men from Moab returned to King Balak and they reported to him, \"Balaam refused to come with us.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-15", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />But Balak sent another group of leaders to Balaam. It was a group that was larger and they were more important than the men in the first group.\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />They went to Balaam and told him this,\"This is what King Balak says, 'Please do not allow anything to hinder you from coming here.\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />I will pay you a lot of money if you come, and I will do anything that you ask me to do. Just come and curse these Israelite people for me!' \"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-18", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />But Balaam answered them, \"Even if Balak would give me a palace filled with silver and gold, I would not do anything to disobey Yahweh, my God.\n\n  <verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />But stay here one more night, like the other messengers did, and I will find out if Yahweh has anything more to say to me.\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />That night God appeared to Balaam again and said to him, \"These men have come to request that you go back with them, so you may go with them, but do only what I tell you to do!\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-21", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />So the next morning, Balaam put a saddle on his donkey and he departed with two of his servants along with the men from Moab.\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />Even though God had given Balaam permission to go, he was still angry. So he sent one of his angels to Balaam. This angel stood in the road to block Balaam's path. As Balaam and the two servants were riding on their donkeys,\n\n  <verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />Balaam's donkey saw the angel. The angel was standing in the road and was holding a sword in his hand, but Balaam did not see him.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">Balaam's donkey turned off the road into a field. So Balaam struck the donkey and forced it to go back onto the road.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-24", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />Then the angel stood in a place where the road was very narrow, between two vineyards, with walls on each side of the road.\n\n<verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />When the donkey saw the angel standing there, it walked very close to the wall to try to get past the angel. As a result, it bashed Balaam's foot against the wall. So Balaam struck the donkey again.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-26", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />Then the angel went further along the road and stood at a place that was extremely narrow, with the result that the donkey could not get past at all.\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />This time, when the donkey saw the angel, it lay down on the ground with Balaam sitting on top of it. Balaam became extremely angry, and he struck the donkey again with his walking stick.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-28", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh enabled the donkey to speak! It said to Balaam, \"What bad thing have I done to you that caused you to strike me three times?\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />Balaam shouted, \"I struck you because you have caused me to appear to be foolish! If I had a sword with me, I would kill you!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />But the donkey answered, \"I am your own donkey, the one that you have always ridden! Have I ever done anything like this previously?\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">Balaam said, \"No.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-31", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"31\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh enabled Balaam to see the angel standing on the road, holding a sword in his hand. Balaam realized that it was an angel and prostrated himself on the ground in front of the angel.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"32\" style=\"v\" />The angel asked him, \"Why did you strike your donkey three times? I have come to block your path because what you are planning to do is wrong.\n\n  <verse number=\"33\" style=\"v\" />Three times your donkey saw me and turned away from me. If it had not done that, I would certainly have killed you already, but I would have allowed the donkey to live.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-34", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"34\" style=\"v\" />Then Balaam said to the angel, \"I have sinned. But I did not realize that you were standing there, trying to block my path. So if you do not want me to continue going, I will return home.\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"35\" style=\"v\" />But the angel replied, \"I will allow you to go with these men, but you must say only what I tell you to say!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">So Balaam went on with the leaders whom Balak had sent.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-36", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"36\" style=\"v\" />When King Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went to meet him at a Moab alongside the Arnon River that was at the border of his own land.\n\n  <verse number=\"37\" style=\"v\" />When he arrived where Balaam was, he said to him, \"I sent you a message saying that you should come immediately! Why did you not come? Did you think that I was not able to pay you a lot of money for coming?\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "22-38", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"38\" style=\"v\" />Balaam replied, \"I have come here now, but I am not able to say anything that I want to. style=\"q2\">Whatever he has said that he will do, he does.</para>\n\n<para style=\"q2\">Whatever he has promised to do, he has done it.</para>\n\n<para style=\"q1\">\n\n<verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />He commanded me to request him to bless the Israelites,</para>\n\n<para style=\"q2\">So he has blessed them, and I cannot change that.</para>\n\n<para style=\"b\" />\n\n<para true king.</para>\n\n<para style=\"q1\">So the descendants of Jacob will not be harmed,</para>\n\n<para style=\"q2\">they will not endure trouble without God.</para>\n\n<para style=\"q1\">\n\n<verse wonderful things for the Israelites!'</para>\n\n<para style=\"q1\"></para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "23-24", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />They are very strong, like prey</para>\n\n<para style=\"q2\">and drunk the blood of the animals they slaughtered.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "23-25", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"25\" replied, \"I told you that I must do only what Yahweh tells me to do!\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />Then King Balak said to Balaam, \"Come with me; I will take you to another place. Perhaps it will please God to allow you to curse them from that place.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "23-28", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />So Balak took Balaam to the top of Mount Peor where they could look down and see the Israelites in the desert.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />Balaam again told Balak, \"Build me seven altars again and kill seven young bulls and seven rams for a sacrifice.\"\n\n  <verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />So Balak did what Balaam told him to do. He burned a young bull and a ram on each altar as sacrifices.</para>\n"}], "number": "23", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "24-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Balaam now realized that Yahweh wanted to bless the Israelite people, not curse them. So he did not use magic like a shaman would do to find out what Yahweh wanted, as he often did. Instead, he turned toward the desert.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "24-02", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />He saw the Israelite people camped there in their tents, with each tribe gathered in one group.
