He showed with his hands that he was very angry, and he shouted, saying, \"I summoned you here to curse my enemies! Instead, you have blessed them three times!\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />So now, get out of here! Go back home! I said that I would pay you a lot of money if you cursed them, but Yahweh has prevented you from getting any pay!\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "24-12", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />Balaam said to Balak, \"Do you not remember what I told the messengers that you sent to me? I cannot do anything bad or anything that is good that he does not approve of.' And I told you that I could say only what Yahweh says to me.\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />So yes, I will return to my people, but first, allow me to tell you what will happen to you Moab The Israelite men accepted. They went to the feasts with the women and worshiped the gods of the Moab people group.\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />By doing that, the Israelite people joined the women in worshiping the god Baal who the Moab people group thought lived on Mount Peor. All of them were descendants of Levi. Kohath was the ancestor of Amram,\n\n  <verse number=\"59\" style=\"v\" />whose wife was Jochebed. She also was a descendant of Levi, but she was born in Egypt. They counted the Israelite people on the plains of Moab, on the east side of the Jordan River, across from Jericho.\n\n  <verse number=\"64\" style=\"v\" />None of the men whom they counted were on the lists that were made by Aaron and Moses when the Israelites were in the Sinai Desert,</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "26-65", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"65\" style=\"v\" />because Yahweh had said about them, \"They will all die in this desert,\" and that is what happened. The only ones who were still alive were Jephunneh's son Caleb and Nun's son Joshua.\n"}], "number": "26", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "27-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />One day the five daughters of Zelophehad came to Moses. They were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "27-02", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />They came to the entrance of the sacred tent and stood in front of Eleazar, Moses, the tribal leaders, and many other Israelite people.\n\n<verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />They said, \"Our father died during the time that we were in the desert, and he did not have any sons. But he was not among those who supported Korah, who rebelled against Yahweh. He died just because he was a sinner like everyone else.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "27-04", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />Why should the name of his clan disappear with the result that we do not receive any land only because our father had no sons? So give us some land like our relatives will be getting!\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />So Moses asked Yahweh what to do about their case.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "27-06", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />And Yahweh replied,\n\n<verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />\"What the daughters of Zelophehad are requesting is right. You must give them some land, just as you are giving to their father's relatives. Give to each of them some of the land that would have been given to their brothers if they had any.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />Also tell this to the Israelite people: 'If a man who has no sons dies, give the things that his sons would have inherited to his daughters.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "27-09", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />If the man has no sons or daughters, give to his brothers the things that his sons and daughters would have inherited.\n\n<verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />If the man had no brothers, give to his father's brothers the things that his sons or daughters or brothers would have inherited.\n\n<verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />If the man's father has no brothers, give to his closest relative the things that the others would have inherited.' That will be a rule for the Israelite people, because I am giving this as a command to you, Moses, to tell them.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "27-12", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />One day, Yahweh said to Moses, \"Climb to the top of the Abarim mountains east of the Jordan River. Then look out over the land that I am giving to the Israelite people.\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />After you have seen it, you will die just like your older brother Aaron did.\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />The reason that you will die and not enter that land is that you both disobeyed my instructions in the Wilderness of Sin. When the Israelite people rebelled against me there at Meribah, near Kadesh, I told you to speak to the rock to cause water to flow out of it. But because you struck the rock instead of speaking to it, you did not show the people my holy power.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "27-15", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />Then Moses said this to Yahweh,\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />\"Yahweh, you are the God who directs the spirits of all people. So please appoint a new leader for the Israelite people.\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />Appoint someone who will lead your people when they go to fight a battle, so that they will not just wander around like sheep that do not have a shepherd.\" </para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "27-18", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh replied, \"Get Joshua son of Nun, who has my Spirit within him. Lay your hands on him to appoint him.\n\n  <verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />Cause him to stand in front of Eleazar the priest, as all the people are watching, and commission him to be the new leader of the Israelite people.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "27-20", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />Give to him some of the authority that you now have, in order that all the Israelite people will know that they must obey him.\n\n<verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />When you all need me to guide you, Joshua will stand in front of Eleazar. Then by casting lots Eleazar will determine what they should do. At Joshua's command all people of Israel will mobilize themselves together.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "27-22", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />So Moses did what Yahweh commanded. He presented Joshua to Eleazar and to all the Israelite people.\n\n  <verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />Moses laid his hands on him and commissioned him to do the work that Yahweh told Moses to tell him to do.</para>\n"}], "number": "27", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "28-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh said this to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell this to the Israelite people, 'Bring to me the offerings that will be burned on the altar. When they are burned, the smell will be very pleasing to me. And tell them that they must bring them at the proper time.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "28-03", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />Tell them that what they must bring to me each day are two male lambs that are one year old. They must have no defects. They must be completely burned on the altar.\n\n<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />They should bring one in the morning and the other early in the evening.\n\n<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />They must also bring a flour offering of two liters of finely-ground flour, mixed with a liter of olive oil.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "28-06", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />That is the offering that they must bring every day. They started to bring those offerings while you were at Mount Sinai. When those offerings are burned on the altar, the smell will be very pleasing to me.\n\n<verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />When they burn each lamb, they must also pour on the sacred altar in the holy place one liter of wine.\n\n<verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />In the evening, when they offer the second lamb, they must also bring the same offerings of flour and wine as they burned in the morning. When they are burned, the smell will also be very pleasing to me.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "28-09", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />On each Sabbath, you must bring two male lambs that have no defects. Those are in addition to the offerings of two lambs and wine that you must bring each day.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "28-11", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />On the first day of each month you must bring to me an offering of two young bulls, one male sheep, and seven male lambs that are one year old. All of these must be without defects. They must all be burned completely on the altar.\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />Also bring with each bull an offering of six liters of finely-ground flour mixed with olive oil. With each male sheep make an offering of four liters of nice flour mixed with olive oil.\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />Also bring an offering of two liters of finely-ground flour mixed with olive oil with each lamb. When all of these are burned on the altar, the smell will be very pleasing to me.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "28-14", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />With each bull also bring two liters of wine. These offerings must be brought on the first day of each month and burned completely on the altar.\n\n<verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />In addition to these offerings that you burn, you must bring to me one goat for an offering to remove the guilt of your sins.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "28-16", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />The Passover festival must be celebrated to honor me each year on the fourteenth day of your first month.\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />The festival of Unleavened Bread will start on the next day. For the following seven days, the bread that you eat must be made without yeast.\n\n  <verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />On the first day of that festival, you must gather together to worship me, and you must not do any work.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "28-19", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />On that day, you must bring to me for an offering that will be completely burned on the altar two young bulls, one male sheep, and seven male lambs that are one year old. They must all have no defects.\n\n<verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />With each of these bulls, bring a grain offering of six liters of finely-ground flour mixed with olive oil. Those are in addition to the offerings that you give to me because you promised to do something, and other special offerings that you want to give to me.\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"40\" style=\"v\" />Then Moses told to the Israelite people all the things that Yahweh had commanded him.</para>\n"}], "number": "29", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "30-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Moses spoke with the leaders of the Israelite tribes. He told them these commands that Yahweh had given to him: </para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />\"If a man solemnly promises Yahweh that he will do something, he must do what he promised.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "30-03", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />If a young woman who is still living with her parents solemnly promises to Yahweh to do something,\n\n  <verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />and if her father hears about what she promised, and if he does not say anything to her, she must do what she promised.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "30-05", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />And if her father hears about all she promised to do, but he says nothing to her, then she must keep all the promises she made. \n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "30-06", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />If her father overrules her on the day he hears all the vows she made and her solemn promises with which she has bound herself, then they will stand. Yahweh will forgive her because her father had overruled her.\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />If she marries a husband while under the vows, or she makes rash utterances by which she obligates herself, they will stand.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "30-08", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />But if her husband stops her on the day that he hears about it, then he cancels the vow that she has made, the rash talk of her lips with which she has bound herself. Yahweh will release her.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "30-09", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />If a widow or a woman who has been divorced makes a promise, she must do what she promised.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />If a woman who is married promises to do something,\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />and if her husband hears about it but does not object, she must do what she promised.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "30-12", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />But if he hears about it and does not allow her to do that, she does not need to do what she promised, and Yahweh will forgive her for not doing it.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "30-13", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />A woman's husband may require her to do what she has promised, or he may not allow her to do what she has promised.\n\n<verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />If he does not object for several days after he hears about it, she must do what she promised.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "30-15", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />But if he waits a long time after she has promised to do something and then he tells her that he will not permit her to do it, if she does not do what she promised, she will not be punished. Her husband is the one whom Yahweh will punish.\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />Those are the rules that Yahweh gave to Moses for husbands and wives, and for young women who are still living with their parents.</para>\n"}], "number": "30", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "31-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh spoke to Moses and said,\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell the Israelite people that they should pay back the Midian people group for what they did to you. After that happens, you will die.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-03", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />So Moses said to the people, \u201cGet some men prepared for battle. Yahweh will enable them to pay back the Midian people group for what they did to us.\n\n  <verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />Select a thousand men from each tribe to fight.\"\n\n  <verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />So twelve thousand men prepared for fighting in the battle, one thousand from each tribe.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-06", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />When Moses sent them to the battle, Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest, went with them. He took with him some of the things from the sacred tent and the trumpets that would be blown to give the signal to start the battle.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />The Israelite men fought the soldiers from the Midian people group, as Yahweh had told Moses to tell them to do, and they killed every man from the Midian people group.\n\n  <verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />Among those whom they killed were the five kings of the Midian people group\u2014Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba. They also killed Balaam with a sword son of Beor.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-09", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />They captured all the women and children of the Midian people group and took away their cattle, their flocks of sheep, and herds of goats, and all their other possessions.\n\n<verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />Then they burned down all the houses in the towns and villages where the people of the Midian people group lived,\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-11", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />but they took home with them all the women and children and animals and possessions.\n\n<verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />They brought all these to Eleazer and Moses, and to the rest of the Israelite people who were at their camp on the plains of Moab, near the Jordan River, across from Jericho.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-13", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />Eleazar and all the leaders of the people and Moses went outside the camp to greet them.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />But Moses was angry with some of the men who had returned from the battle. He was angry with the army officers and the men who were commanders of a thousand men and those who were commanders of a hundred men.\n\n  <verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />He asked them, \u201cWhy did you allow the women to live?</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-16", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />They are the ones who did what Balaam suggested and urged our people to worship Baal instead of Yahweh. As a result, Yahweh caused a plague to strike his people while they were at Peor.\n\n<verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />So, now you must kill all the boys of the Midian people group, and also kill all the women who have had sex with any man.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-18", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />Spare only the girls who are virgins. You can keep them to be your wives or your slaves.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />All of you who have killed someone or touched the corpse of someone who was killed in the battle must stay outside the camp for seven days. On the third day and on the seventh day, you must perform the ritual to enable you to become acceptable to God again.\n\n  <verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />You must also wash your clothes and anything that you took to the battle that is made of leather or goat's hair or wood.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-21", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />Then Eleazar said to the soldiers who had returned from the battle, \"This is what Yahweh has instructed Moses. \n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />You must put into a fire any gold or silver or bronze or iron or tin or lead things that you brought back from the battle.\n\n  <verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />Put everything that will not burn into the fire, and then they will be acceptable for you to use. But also sprinkle those things with the water that causes things and people to become acceptable to God. The things that would burn if you put them in a fire, sprinkle them with that water.\n\n  <verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />On the seventh day, wash your clothes, and then you will become acceptable to God again. After you do that, you may return to the camp.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-25", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh also said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell Eleazar and the leaders of the family groups that they must write down a list of all the goods, the women, and the animals that were captured in the battle.\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />Then they must divide all those things between the men who fought in the battle and the rest of the people.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-28", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />From the men who fought in the battle, take one from every five hundred people and from every five hundred cattle and donkeys and sheep, to be a tax for me.\n\n<verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />Take these things to Eleazar to be my share as the offering presented to me.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-30", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />And from the other things, take one item from every fifty. That includes people, cattle, donkeys, sheep, goats, and other animals. Give those things to the descendants of Levi who take care of my sacred tent.\"\n\n<verse number=\"31\" style=\"v\" />So Eleazar and Moses did what Yahweh commanded.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-32", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"32-35\" style=\"v\" />There were 675,000 sheep, 72,000 cattle, 61,000 donkeys, and 32,000 virgins that they had captured from the Midian people group.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-36", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"36\" style=\"v\" />The men who fought in the battle took 337,000 sheep from the battle,\n\n  <verse number=\"37\" style=\"v\" />and they gave 675 of them to Yahweh.\n\n  <verse number=\"38\" style=\"v\" />They took 36,000 cattle and gave 72 of them to Yahweh.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-39", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"39\" style=\"v\" />They took 30,500 donkeys, and they gave 61 of them to Yahweh.\n\n<verse number=\"40\" style=\"v\" />They took 16,000 virgins, and they gave 32 of them to Yahweh.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"41\" style=\"v\" />Moses gave to Eleazar all the animals that had been presented to Yahweh, as Yahweh had commanded.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-42", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"42-46\" style=\"v\" />Moses separated what those who had fought in the battle received from what the other people received. The people received  337,500 sheep, 36,000 cattle, 30,500 donkeys, and 16,000 virgins.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-47", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"47\" style=\"v\" />From what the people received, Moses took one from every fifty items and gave them to Yahweh. That included animals and people. As Yahweh commanded, Moses gave them all to the descendants of Levi who took care of the sacred tent.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-48", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"48\" style=\"v\" />Then the army officers and those who commanded a thousand men and those who commanded a hundred men came to Moses.\n\n  <verse number=\"49\" style=\"v\" />They said, \"We, who are your servants, have counted the soldiers whom we command, and we found that none of them is missing.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-50", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"50\" style=\"v\" />So to thank Yahweh for that, we have brought to him a gift of the gold items that we found after the battle, gold arm bands and bracelets and rings, earrings and necklaces. We hope that this will atone for our sins.\"\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"51\" style=\"v\" />So Eleazar and Moses accepted the gold items that they brought.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "31-52", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"52\" style=\"v\" />The total of the offering they presented weighed about 191 kilograms.\n\n<verse number=\"53\" style=\"v\" />Each soldier had taken these things for himself.\n\n<verse number=\"54\" style=\"v\" />Eleazar and Moses accepted these gold items from these commanders and put them in the sacred tent to remind the Israelite people about how Yahweh had helped them defeat the Midian people group.\n"}], "number": "31", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "32-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />The people of the tribes of Reuben and Gad had a lot of livestock. They saw that the land near the city of Jazer and the region of Gilead east of the Jordan River had good grass for the animals to graze on.\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />So their leaders came to Eleazar and the leaders of the people and Moses. They said,\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />\"We have a great amount of livestock.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-04", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh has enabled us Israelites to capture some land that is very good for animals to graze on\u2014the land near the towns of Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon.\n\n<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />If it pleases you, we would like this land to be ours, instead of land on the other side of the Jordan River.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-06", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />Moses replied to the leaders of the tribes of Gad and Reuben, \u201cIt is not right for  your fellow Israelites to go to fight in wars and you stay here!\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />If you do that, you will cause the other Israelites to be discouraged, with the result that they will not cross the Jordan River to the land that Yahweh is giving to them.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-08", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />Our ancestors did the same kind of thing. I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to see what the land of Canaan was like.\n\n<verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />They went as far as Eshcol Valley, but when they saw the huge people in the land, they returned and caused the Israelite people to be discouraged saying, 'We should not try to enter the land that Yahweh said that he is giving to us.'\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-10", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />So Yahweh became very angry with them, and he solemnly declared this,\n\n<verse number=\"11-12\" style=\"v\" />'From all the people who came out of Egypt, the only ones who are at least twenty years old who will see the land that I promised to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, are Jephunneh's son Caleb and Nun's son Joshua, because they trusted me completely. None of the other people who came out of Egypt will even see that land, because they have not completely believed in my power.'\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-13", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />So Yahweh was angry with the Israelite people, and as a result he has caused us to wander in this desert for forty years. Finally, all the people who had sinned against Yahweh by refusing to trust him died, one by one.\n\n<verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />And you are acting like your ancestors did! You sinful Israelite people are going to cause Yahweh to be more angry with you than he was with our ancestors!\n\n<verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />If you stop trusting him, he will cause you and all your fellow Israelites to stay longer in the desert, and he will get rid of all of you!\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-16", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />Then the leaders of the tribes of Reuben and Gad said to Moses, \"First we will build pens for our animals and build cities for our families here.\n\n  <verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />Then our families will live in strong cities with walls around them, and they will be safe from the people who live in this land. Then we will get ready to fight battles. We will help the other Israelites to get land on the other side of the river.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-18", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />We will not return to our homes until every Israelite has received some land.\n\n<verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />We will not take any land on the west side of the Jordan River, because our land will be here on the east side.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-20", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />So Moses told them, \"I will tell you what you must do. You must get ready to fight battles for Yahweh.\n\n  <verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />You must cross the Jordan River carrying your weapons.\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />After Yahweh helps us to take that land from the people who live there, you will be permitted to return to your homes. You will have done what you have promised Yahweh and the Israelite people that you would do, and you may keep this land to be your own, given to you by Yahweh.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-23", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />But if you do not do these things, you will be sinning against Yahweh, and he will punish you for that sin.\n\n  <verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />Now you can build cities for your families and pens for your animals, but after doing that, you must do what you have promised.\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />The leaders of the tribes of Gad and Reuben replied, \"We will do what you have asked us to do, because you are our leader.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-26", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />Our wives and children and our cattle and sheep and goats will stay here in the cities of the Gilead area,\n\n<verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />but we will prepare to go to battle. We will take our weapons and go across the Jordan River and fight for Yahweh, just as you, our leader, have said.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-28", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />So Moses gave instructions about them to Eleazar, Joshua, and the leaders of the Israelite tribes.\n\n  <verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />Moses said to them, \"If the men from the tribes of Gad and Reuben prepare for battle and cross the Jordan River with you, in order to do what Yahweh desires and help you to take that land, give them the Gilead area to belong to them.\n\n  <verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />But if they do not take their weapons and go with you prepared to fight, they will not receive this land. They will need to accept some land in Canaan, like the rest of you will do.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-31", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"31\" style=\"v\" />The leaders of the tribes of Gad and Reuben replied, \"We will do what you have said and what Yahweh has said.\n\n  <verse number=\"32\" style=\"v\" />We will cross the river into Canaan land, and we will do what Yahweh desires and be prepared for battle. But our land will be here on the east side of the Jordan River.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-33", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"33\" style=\"v\" />So Moses agreed to give that land to the tribes of Gad and Reuben and to half of the tribe of Joseph's son Manasseh. That land was previously the land where Sihon, the king of the Amor people group, ruled, and the land where Og, the king of Bashan region, ruled, including its cities and surrounding land.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-34", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"34\" style=\"v\" />The people of the tribe of Gad rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,\n\n  <verse number=\"35\" style=\"v\" />Atroth Shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,\n\n  <verse number=\"36\" style=\"v\" />Beth Nimrah, and Beth Haran cities. And they also built pens for their sheep.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-37", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"37\" style=\"v\" />The people of the tribe of Reuben rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,\n\n  <verse number=\"38\" style=\"v\" />Nebo, Baal Meon, and Sibmah cities. When they rebuilt Nebo and Baal Meon, they gave new names to those cities.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"39\" style=\"v\" />The descendants of Manasseh's son Makir went to the region of Gilead and took it away from the Amor people group.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "32-40", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"40\" style=\"v\" />So Moses gave Gilead to the family of Makir, and they started to live there.\n\n<verse number=\"41\" style=\"v\" />Jair, who was also a descendant of Manasseh, went and captured the small towns in that region, and he named them the Towns of Jair.\n\n<verse number=\"42\" style=\"v\" />A man named Nobah went and captured the city of Kenath and the nearby towns, and then he used his own name to be the new name of that area.\n"}], "number": "32", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "33-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Here is a list of the places where the Israelites went as Aaron and Moses led them after they left Egypt.\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh commanded Moses to write down the names of the places where they went.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "33-03", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />On the fifteenth day of the first month of the year, the day after we celebrated the Passover, they left the city of Rameses in Egypt and marched boldly while the Egyptian army was coming behind them.\n\n<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />As they left, the people of Egypt were still burying the bodies of their firstborn sons. By killing them, Yahweh showed that the gods that the people of Egypt worshiped were false gods.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "33-05", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />After leaving Rameses, they first went to Succoth and set up their tents there.\n\n<verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />Then they left Succoth and went to Etham, at the edge of the desert, and set up their tents there.\n\n<verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />Then they left Etham and returned to Pi Hahiroth, to the east of Baal Zephon, and set up their tents near Migdol.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "33-08", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />Then they left Pi Hahiroth and walked through the Sea of Reeds and continued three days into the Etham Desert, and set their tents at Marah.\n\n<verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />Then they left Marah and went to Elim. There were twelve springs and seventy palm trees there. Their tents stretched for several kilometers from Beth Jeshimoth to Abel Shittim.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "33-50", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"50\" style=\"v\" />While we were there on the plains of Moab near the Jordan River, across from Jericho, Yahweh spoke to Moses. He said,\n\n  <verse number=\"51\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell this to the Israelite people, 'When you cross the Jordan River and enter the region of Canaan,\n\n  <verse number=\"52\" style=\"v\" />you must force all the people who live there to leave. Destroy all their carved figures and all cast figures made of metal. Wreck all the places where they worship their idols.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "33-53", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"53\" style=\"v\" />Take their land from them and start to live there, because I have given their land to you for you to own.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"54\" style=\"v\" />Divide up the land by throwing lots to decide which group will get which area. Give the larger areas to the groups that have more people, and give the smaller areas to the groups that have fewer people. Each tribe will receive its own land.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "33-55", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"55\" style=\"v\" />If you do not force the people who live there to leave, they will cause you to have much trouble. They will be like sharp hooks in your eyes, and like thorns in your sides. And they will bring trouble to you, in that land where you will be living.\n\n<verse number=\"56\" style=\"v\" />And then I will punish you, as I had planned to punish them.' \"\n"}], "number": "33", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "34-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell this to the Israelite people, 'You will soon enter Canaan land, and it will become yours. The following will be the borders of the land.\n\n  <verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />On the south you will receive part of the Wilderness of Sin, near the border of the region of Edom. On the east side, the border will start at the south end of the Dead Sea.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "34-04", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />It will extend to a little south of the Scorpion Pass, and extend west through the Zin Desert and south of Kadesh Barnea. From there it will extend to Hazar Addar and from there to Azmon.\n\n  <verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />From Azmon it will extend west to the dry riverbed at the border of Egypt and then to the Mediterranean Sea.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "34-06", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />The border on the west will be the Mediterranean Sea.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "34-07", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />The border on the north will start from the Mediterranean Sea and extend west to Mount Hor.\n\n  <verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />From there it will extend to Lebo Hamath and then to Zedad.\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />From there the border will extend to Ziphron, and it will end at Hazar Enan.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "34-10", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />The border on the east will start at Hazar Enan and extend south to Shepham.\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />From there it will extend east of Ain to Riblah and then along the hills that are east of Galilee Lake.\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />Then the border will extend south along the Jordan River and end at the Dead Sea.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">Those will be the borders around your country.' \"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "34-13", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />So Moses told all that to the Israelite people. Then he said to them, \u201cThat is the land that you will receive. You must throw lots to decide which area will go to each of the nine and a half tribes, because Yahweh has commanded that it should be divided among them.\n\n  <verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />The tribes of Reuben, Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh have already received the land in which they will live.\n\n  <verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />They have received land on the east side of the Jordan River, across from Jericho.\"</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "34-16", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"16\" style=\"v\" />Then Yahweh said to Moses,</para>\n\n<para style=\"q1\">\n\n<verse number=\"17\" style=\"v\" />\"These are the men who will divide the land. First, Eleazar and Joshua,\n\n<verse number=\"18\" style=\"v\" />but other leaders from each of the twelve tribes will help them divide the land.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "34-19", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />From the tribe of Judah, appoint Jephunneh's son Caleb.</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" Benjamin appoint Kislon's son Elidad.</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />From the tribe of Dan appoint Jogli's son Bukki.</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse "<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />From the tribe of Asher appoint Shelomi's son Ahihud.</para>\n\n<para style=\"li1\">\n\n<verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />From the tribe of Naphtali appoint Ammihud's son Pedahel.\"</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh commanded that all those were the men who should divide the region of Canaan among the Israelite people.</para>\n"}], "number": "34", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "35-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh told this to Moses while the Israelites were on the plain in Moab near the Jordan River, across from Jericho,\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell the Israelite people that from the land that they will receive, they must give to the descendants of Levi some cities in which they can live. They must also give them some land around these cities.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-03", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />These cities will be for the descendants of Levi to live in, and around the cities will be land for their cattle and flocks of sheep and goats and other animals.\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />The land that you give them for their animals must extend out for 457 meters from the walls of the cities.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-05", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />Also measure 914 meters in each direction out from the walls of each city. That additional land will be land for their animals outside the walls of the cities.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-06", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />Six of the cities that you give to the descendants of Levi will be cities to which people can run to be safe. If someone accidentally kills someone else, the one who killed that person may run to one of those cities to be safe.\n\n  <verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />You must also give to the descendants of Levi forty-two other cities and the land around those cities for their animals.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-08", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />The Israelite tribes who have the most people must give them more cities than the tribes who have fewer people give. Each tribe must give some of its cities to the descendants of Levi, but the tribes that have more land must give more cities, and the tribes that have fewer cities will give fewer cities.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-09", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh also said to Moses,\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />\"Tell this to the Israelite people, 'When you cross the Jordan River and enter the region of Canaan,\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />you must choose some cities to which people can run to be safe. If someone kills another person, the one who killed that person may run to one of those cities and be safe.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-12", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />One of the relatives of the person who was killed may think he must avenge his relative's death by killing the murderer. But in that city, the killer will be safe because the people in that city would kill those relatives if they tried to get revenge there. The man who killed someone accidentally must be put on trial in a court.\n\n<verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />You must set apart six cities to be cities to which someone who killed another person accidentally may run and be safe.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-14", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"14\" style=\"v\" />There must be three of these cities on the east side of the Jordan River and three on the west side, in the region of Canaan.\n\n<verse number=\"15\" style=\"v\" />Those six cities will be cities where Israelite people may run and be safe, and where foreigners and other people who are living among you can also run and be safe. Any of those people who accidentally kills someone may run to one of these cities and be safe there.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-16", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"16-18\" style=\"v\" />But you must consider that anyone who kills another person with an iron weapon or with a big rock or with a piece of wood, is a murderer, and the one who killed the other person must be executed.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-19", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"19\" style=\"v\" />A relative of the person who was murdered must be the one who executes the murderer as soon as he finds him.\n\n<verse number=\"20\" style=\"v\" />If someone shoves another person over a cliff or throws something at another person\n\n<verse number=\"21\" style=\"v\" />or hits that person with his hand and causes that person to die, if he did it because he hated that person, then you must consider that he is a murderer, and must be executed. A relative of the person who was killed must be the one who executes the murderer as soon as he finds him.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-22", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"22\" style=\"v\" />But someone might accidentally shove someone else, or he might accidentally throw something at another person and hit him, but not because he hates that person.\n\n  <verse number=\"23\" style=\"v\" />Or he might drop a rock on someone that he could not see. If the one who does that did not plan to hurt anyone and did not hate the person who was killed,</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-24", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"24\" style=\"v\" />then the people of that city must decide whether the relative of the dead person has the right to get revenge, or whether the one who killed the other person truly did it accidentally.\n\n<verse number=\"25\" style=\"v\" />If they decide that the killer planned to kill the other person, they must not allow him to stay in their city. But if they decide that it was done accidentally, they must protect the killer from being killed by the dead person's relative. They must send the killer to one of the cities where he will be safe, and allow him to stay there until the high priest dies. After that, the killer may go back to his home, because the dead person's relative no longer has the right to get revenge.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-26", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"26\" style=\"v\" />But while the high priest is still living, the person who is in that safe city must not leave that city.\n\n  <verse number=\"27\" style=\"v\" />If he goes outside the city, and if a relative of the dead person finds him, that relative is permitted to kill that person, and people will not consider that the relative is guilty of murder.\n\n  <verse number=\"28\" style=\"v\" />The killer must stay in that city where he will be safe until the high priest dies. He will be safe from revenge after that, because the death of the high priest will be considered to be a sacrifice to atone for that murder. After that, the killer may return to his home.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-29", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"29\" style=\"v\" />You must always obey these legal proceedings, wherever you live.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"30\" style=\"v\" />If someone is accused of killing another person, the one who is accused may be executed only if there are people who saw him do it. There must be more than one witness. No one is permitted to be executed if there was only one witness.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-31", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"31\" style=\"v\" />If there is a murderer who truly should be executed, do not spare his life by accepting a ransom. He must be executed.</para>\n\n<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"32\" style=\"v\" />If someone has run to a city where he will be safe, do not allow him to give you money in order that you will permit him to return to his home before the high priest dies.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "35-33", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"33\" style=\"v\" />You must execute people who truly murder others. If you did not do that, you would be causing the people who live in the land to become unacceptable to me. Anyone who deliberately kills an innocent person must be executed.\n\n  <verse number=\"34\" style=\"v\" />I am Yahweh, and I live among you Israelites, so do not spoil the land by allowing people to murder others without being punished.' \"</para>\n"}], "number": "35", "ref": "", "title": ""}, {"frames": [{"format": "usx", "id": "36-01", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"1\" style=\"v\" />The family leaders of the clan of Gilead of the tribe of Manasseh went to Moses and the other family leaders of the Israelite people.\n\n  <verse number=\"2\" style=\"v\" />They said to Moses, \u201cYahweh commanded you, our leader, to apportion the land to the Israelite tribes by throwing lots to decide which group would get which area. Yahweh also commanded you to give the land that belonged to our fellow Israelite Zelophehad to his daughters.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "36-03", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"3\" style=\"v\" />But if his daughters marry men from the other Israelite tribes, that land will no longer belong to our tribe. People of other tribes will get it. So some of our land will no longer belong to us.\n\n<verse number=\"4\" style=\"v\" />When the Year of Celebration comes, when all the land that has been bought by someone is returned to its original owners, the land that belonged to Zelophehad will belong to the tribes of the men that his daughters marry. So some of our land, the land that we received from our fathers, will be taken from us, and we will never own it again.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "36-05", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"5\" style=\"v\" />Yahweh told Moses what to reply to them, so Moses said this to them, \"These men from the tribe of Manasseh are right.\n\n  <verse number=\"6\" style=\"v\" />This is what Yahweh is saying to the daughters of Zelophehad,  'Each of you may marry anyone you want to, but you must marry only someone from your own tribe.'</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "36-07", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"7\" style=\"v\" />In that way, the land that belongs to Israelites will not be passed from one tribe to another tribe. Each Israelite will keep the land in the tribe that belonged to his ancestors.\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "36-08", "img": "", "text": "<verse number=\"8\" style=\"v\" />A woman who inherits her father's land may get married, but she must marry someone from her own tribe. In that way, every Israelite will keep the land that belonged to his ancestors.\n\n<verse number=\"9\" style=\"v\" />The land must not be passed from one tribe to another tribe. Each Israelite tribe must keep the land that it received from its ancestors.\"\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "36-10", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"10\" style=\"v\" />Zelophehad's daughters obeyed what Yahweh told Moses.\n\n  <verse number=\"11\" style=\"v\" />The five daughters\u2014Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah and Noah\u2014married their cousins, their father's relatives.\n\n  <verse number=\"12\" style=\"v\" />The men whom they married were from the tribe of Manasseh, so their land continued to belong to their father's family and tribe.</para>\n"}, {"format": "usx", "id": "36-00", "img": "", "text": "<para style=\"p\">\n\n  <verse number=\"13\" style=\"v\" />Those were the commands and decrees that Yahweh gave to Moses to tell to the Israelites, while they were on the plains of Moab, close to the Jordan River, across from Jericho.</para>"}], "number": "36", "ref": "", "title": ""}], "date_modified": "20160223"}";s:10:"write_time";i:1460730757;s:10:"expired_in";i:604800;s:12:"expired_time";i:1461335557;s:4:"size";i:280535;}
